info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 21 at 10:11AM PDT until July 22 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...AN EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING UNTIL 11 PM PDT SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, high temperatures 99 to 104 degrees expected in the Lower Sierra foothills, Yosemite Valley, and Kern River Valley this afternoon. For the Excessive Heat Warning, high temperatures 100 to 105 degrees expected in the Lower Sierra foothills, Yosemite Valley, and Kern River Valley Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Lower Sierra Nevada foothills, Yosemite Valley, and Kern River Valley. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 11 AM PDT this morning until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 11 PM PDT this evening until 11 PM PDT Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, remain in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
